Code documentation¶

esgmapfiles.py¶

platform:Unix
synopsis:Build ESGF mapfiles without esgscan_directory upon local ESGF datanode.
class esgmapfiles.ProcessingContext(args)[source]¶

Encapsulates the following processing context/information for main process:

Attribute Type Description
self.directory list Paths to scan
self.latest boolean True if latest version
self.outdir str Output directory
self.verbose boolean True if verbose mode
self.with_version boolean True to include version in dataset ID
self.project str Project
self.dataset boolean True if one mapfile per dataset
self.checksum boolean True if checksums into mapfile
self.outmap str Mapfile output name
self.cfg callable Configuration file parser
self.pattern re object DRS regex pattern
self.dtemp str Directory of temporary files
Parameters:args (dict) – Parsed command-line arguments
Returns:The processing context
Return type:dict
Raises Error:If the project name is inconsistent with the sections names from the configuration file
esgmapfiles.get_args(job)[source]¶

Returns parsed command-line arguments. See esg_mapfiles -h for full description. A job dictionnary can be used as developper’s entry point to overload the parser.

Parameters:job (dict) – Optionnal dictionnary instead of command-line arguments.
Returns:The corresponding argparse Namespace
esgmapfiles.get_master_ID(attributes, ctx)[source]¶

Builds the master identifier of a dataset.

Parameters:
  • attributes (dict) – The attributes auto-detected with DRS pattern
  • ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
Returns:

The master ID with the version
Return type:

str
esgmapfiles.check_facets(attributes, ctx, file)[source]¶

Checks all attributes from path. Each attribute or facet is auto-detected using the DRS pattern (regex) and compared to its corresponding options declared into the configuration file.

Parameters:
  • attributes (dict) – The attributes auto-detected with DRS pattern
  • ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
Raises Error:

If an option of an attribute is not declared
esgmapfiles.checksum(file, ctx)[source]¶

Does the MD5 or SHA256 checksum by the Shell avoiding Python memory limits.

Parameters:
  • file (str) – The full path of a file
  • ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
Raises Error:

If the checksum fails
esgmapfiles.rmdtemp(ctx)[source]¶

Removes the temporary directory and its content.

Parameters:ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
esgmapfiles.yield_inputs(ctx)[source]¶

Yields all files to process within tuples with the processing context. The file walking through the DRS tree follows symbolic links and ignores the “files” directories and “latest” symbolic links if --latest is None.

Parameters:ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
Returns:Attach the processing context to a file to process as an iterator of tuples
Return type:iter
esgmapfiles.write(outfile, msg)[source]¶

Writes in a mapfile using the with statement.

Parameters:
  • outfile (str) – The mapfile full path
  • msg (str) – The line to write
esgmapfiles.wrapper(inputs)[source]¶

Transparent wrapper for pool map.

Parameters:inputs (tuple) – A tuple with the file path and the processing context
Returns:The _file_process() call
Return type:callable
esgmapfiles.counted(fct)[source]¶

Decorator used to count all file process calls.

Parameters:fct (callable) – The function to monitor
Returns:A wrapped function with a .called attribute
Return type:callable
esgmapfiles.file_process(inputs)[source]¶
File process that:
  • Auto-detects facets,
  • Builds dataset ID,
  • Does checksums,
  • Writes to appropriate mapfile.
Parameters:inputs (tuple) – A tuple with the file path and the processing context
Returns:The output mapfile name
Return type:str
esgmapfiles.run(job=None)[source]¶
Main process that:
  • Instantiates processing context,
  • Creates mapfiles output directory if necessary,
  • Instantiates threads pools,
  • Copies mapfile(s) to the output directory,
  • Removes the temporary directory and its contents.
  • Implement exit status values as described in get_args (search for ‘epilog’)
Parameters:job (dict) – A job from SYNDA if supplied instead of classical command-line use.

Module author: Levavasseur Guillaume (CNRS/IPSL) <glipsl@ipsl.jussieu.fr>

checkvocab.py¶

platform:Unix
synopsis:Utility to check (and update) the configuration INI file used by esg_mapfiles.
class checkvocab.ProcessingContext(args)[source]¶

Encapsulates the following processing context/information for main process:

Attribute Type Description
self.directory list Paths to scan
self.project str Project
self.cfg callable Configuration file parser
self.pattern re object DRS regex pattern
Parameters:args (dict) – Parsed command-line arguments
Returns:The processing context
Return type:dict
Raises Error:If the project name is inconsistent with the sections names from the configuration file
checkvocab.get_args()[source]¶

Returns parsed command-line arguments. See esg_mapfiles_check_vocab -h for full description.

Returns:The corresponding argparse Namespace
checkvocab.get_dsets_from_tree(ctx)[source]¶

Yields datasets to process. Only the “dataset part” of the DRS tree is returned (i.e., from “root” to “member/ensemble” facet).

Parameters:ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
Returns:The dataset as a part of the DRS tree
Return type:iter
checkvocab.strip_hash_to_end(id)[source]¶

Cuts the dataset_ID before the ending version.

Parameters:id (str) – The dataset_id string
Returns:The dataset_ID without version
Return type:str
checkvocab.id_components(id)[source]¶

Converts/splits the dataset_ID string into a list of facets.

Parameters:id (str) – The dataset_ID string
Returns:The facets list
Return type:list
checkvocab.get_facets_from_config(ctx)[source]¶

Returns all facets described by the dataset_ID option from the configuration file.

Parameters:ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
Returns:The facets list
Return type:list
checkvocab.get_facet_values_from_tree(ctx, dsets, facets)[source]¶

Returns all used values of each facet from the DRS tree, according to the supplied direcotries.

Parameters:
  • ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
  • dsets (iter) – The dataset part of the DRS tree
  • facets (list) – The facets list
Returns:

The declared values of each facet
Return type:

dict
checkvocab.get_facet_values_from_config(ctx, facets)[source]¶

Returns all declared values of each facet from the configuration file, according to the project section.

Parameters:
  • ctx (dict) – The processing context (as a ProcessingContext() class instance)
  • facets (list) – The facets list
Returns:

The declared values of each facet
Return type:

dict
checkvocab.compare_values(project, facets, used_values, declared_values)[source]¶

Compares used values from DRS tree with all declared values in configuration file for each facet.

Parameters:
  • project (str) – The project name
  • facets (list) – The facets list
  • used_values (dict) – The used values from DRS tree
  • declared_values (dict) – The declred values from the configuration file
Returns:

True if undeclared values in configuration file are used in DRS tree
Return type:

boolean
checkvocab.main()[source]¶
Main process that:
  • Instanciates processing context
  • Parses the configuration files options and values,
  • Deduces facets and values from directories,
  • Compares the values of each facet between both,
  • Print or log the checking.

Module author: Levavasseur Guillaume (CNRS/IPSL) <glipsl@ipsl.jussieu.fr>

Code author: Iwi Alan (BADC) <alan.iwi@stfc.ac.uk>>
